TopicTitle: Mk3 to 3.75 and Mk3 to 2.5 Hollow adapters ? And more.

Articles.Content:
Hello. 

Basically I have these parts :

![c3grG.jpg](http://snag.gy/c3grG.jpg)![B2Xk2.jpg](http://i.snag.gy/B2Xk2.jpg)![Gs8LB.jpg](http://i.snag.gy/Gs8LB.jpg)

I want to make a hollow hull, where I can store my stuff and also be able to (un)load from both ends.

I have recoded and repurposed lots of my parts, but have always used basic unmodified models.

There is 3.75 to mk3 fuel tank as well as mk3 to 2.5(even 2 variants), so making that hollow may not mean doing it from a scratch, but I am simply incompetent in modeling. 

-

I am not sure about the inside of the hollow 3.75 to mk3, because I will need a ramp on 1 of the sides, so the rover can move between the parts.

![1PqPN.jpg](http://i.snag.gy/1PqPN.jpg)

-

The Mk4 fits ramp wise, but that is pretty much it.

I also have mk4 cargo door for the back, so 3.75 to mk4 hollow adapter (with ramp inside) will be neat as well.

There are mk4 to 1.25 and 2.5 fuel tanks in the pack, but not mk4 to 3.75 or mk3.

![miTP5.jpg](http://i.snag.gy/miTP5.jpg)

Also if it is possible (And I am aware it is a huge optional request) for this 3.75 part part to be made in :

1. double length

2. With opening hatches

2.1 With opening hatches and no ramp (So it will be possible to open them in the bottom and extend a ramp like shown on this picture.

![oJ39W.jpg](http://i.snag.gy/oJ39W.jpg)

I will post a link to this topic in the respective parts owners' topics as well, but for now the most important parts for me are the 3.75 to mk3 hollow adapter (with ramps to align) and the 3.75 part with opening hatches.

Parts list for better alignment and their respective owners/topics in the forum :

Mk3 cargo bay is stock.

Mk4 Parts : [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101699](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101699)

Cockpit, 3.75 hollow fuselage and mk3 ramp: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79542](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79542) - SXT

The SXT seem to have no problems license wise to modify and build upon their models, as long as they are credited for the basic product. [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/)

Mk4 Parts as well. 

> 
> You are free to share and adapt the materials only for non-commercial purposes and when providing appropriate attribution. Any derivatives must be distributed under the same license.

EDIT: By "ramp" I refer to the flat part inside the tube parts.

Anybody having the time and skill to do this ? Or at least just the mk3 to 3.75 hollow ?
Why do you need a hollow mk3 to mk2 adapter? From my experience, at least, using just two 1.5m engines won't provide nearly enough power for a giant mk3 aircraft.

Think of it in reverse. For a nice mk2 front part. Like the mk2 to 1.5 version.

But as I said the most important one for me is hollow mk3 to 3.75m possibly with one of the inside sides flat like in the picture.

Fantastic. I have been looking for parts like this for a long time....

Good luck and keep pushing it...

Cheers.

Here are some clarification for potential enthusiasts 

This is the detail you can use as base :

![OFjaI.jpg](http://snag.gy/OFjaI.jpg)

This is the 3.75 side of the adapter relative to the 3.75 cargo bay :

![M87EA.jpg](http://snag.gy/M87EA.jpg)

This is the mk3 relative and basic idea how the joint will be used :

![uLaUt.jpg](http://snag.gy/uLaUt.jpg)

This is poorly drawn schematic of the 3.75 parts needed. 

Basically one with the flat surface and one without. 

Both with opening hatches. 

Length wise - as long as they are, but if you feel like it you can add double sized ones for reduced part count for total of 4 parts. 

The colliding ramp is separate part, so ignore it.

![ADo8P.jpg](http://snag.gy/ADo8P.jpg)

Now the adapter. Something like a small ramp inside the hollow mk3 to 3.75 detail.

Despite the picture, no opening hatch. Just used the old picture. Also the transition mk3 to 3.75 plus hatches will not look nice.

![X8W7W.jpg](http://snag.gy/X8W7W.jpg)

Thank you in advance !
